body_html: Here's how I fixed it. I had both CUDA 9.1 and CUDA 9.0 installed. Like others, I had to upgrade my GPU drivers again after installing CUDA (via the Geforce Experience program). Keras' backend TensorFlow is using CUDA 9.0 as of today's date, so make sure you have that installed. Then, download cuDNN 7.0.5 (not the latest 7.1 version) from https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download and then extract it and copy the bin, include, etc folders over to your C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0 folder. Now it should work.
body_text: Here's how I fixed it. I had both CUDA 9.1 and CUDA 9.0 installed. Like others, I had to upgrade my GPU drivers again after installing CUDA (via the Geforce Experience program). Keras' backend TensorFlow is using CUDA 9.0 as of today's date, so make sure you have that installed. Then, download cuDNN 7.0.5 (not the latest 7.1 version) from https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download and then extract it and copy the bin, include, etc folders over to your C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0 folder. Now it should work.
body: Here's how I fixed it. I had both CUDA 9.1 and CUDA 9.0 installed. Like others, I had to upgrade my GPU drivers again after installing CUDA (via the Geforce Experience program). Keras' backend TensorFlow is using CUDA 9.0 as of today's date, so make sure you have that installed. Then, download cuDNN 7.0.5 (not the latest 7.1 version) from https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download and then extract it and copy the bin, include, etc folders over to your C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\CUDA\v9.0 folder. Now it should work.
